Having lived for many years in Portland, Oregon, brunch is the only way to do breakfast on a weekend.  I love living in Barcelona but I really miss brunch.  Thank goodness I found Milk, which really "gets" American-style brunch.  And like any good brunch spot in Portland, there is a long line for a table here too!My friend & I shared three dishes: blueberry pancakes, the Mexican-style omelette, and the goat cheese salad.  The plates were quite large and tasty.  My few complaints were that the mexican omelette was a little off the mark, since the hard Spanish spicy chorizo is just not the same as crumbly Mexican chorizo, and the fried potatoes were seasoned well but a bit too mushy.Now if only they served bottomless drip coffee, I might not notice that I'm in Europe!  But alas, drip coffee is unknown here in Spain.  That's ok, I can't complain about a tasty espresso drink.
